MOHAMMED EMRAN HOSSAIN (1979, BANGLADESH) RECEIVED BACHELOR OF ARCHITECTURE FROM BANGLADESH UNIVERSITY OF ENGINEERING AND TECHNOLOGY (BUET) IN 2004 AND MASTER OF ARCHITECTURE DEGREE FROM HARVARD UNIVERSITY, GRADUATE SCHOOL OF DESIGN IN 2007. HE WORKED AS PROJECT ARCHITECT AT VISTAARA ARCHITECTS, DHAKA, AND AS AN INSTRUCTOR AT BRAC UNIVERSITY FROM 2004 UNTIL HIS ENROLLMENT IN THE MASTER'S PROGRAM AT HARVARD, GSD. AFTER HE GRADUATED FROM HARVARD, GSD, EMRAN WORKED AT STEVEN HOLL ARCHITECTS, NEW YORK; FROM 2007 TO 2009. AT STEVEN HOLL ARCHITECTS, EMRAN PRIMARILY WORKED ON 'SLICED POROSITY BLOCK' (CHENGDU, CHINA) AND AT DIFFERENT STAGES OF ' LINK HYBRID (BEIJING, CHINA) AND VANKE (SHENZHEN, CHINA) PROJECT. BESIDES
HIS EXTENSIVE WORK EXPERIENCE, EMRAN HAS ALSO WON A NUMBER OF AWARDS SINCE HE WAS STUDENT; FURTHER EXEMPLIFYING HIS EXTENSIVE SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE AND MASTERY OF ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN. IN 2010, EMRAN
COLLABORATED HIS DHAKA BASED PRACTICE 'PROJECT-BD ARCHITECTS' ALONG WITH ARCHITECT IMTIAJUL ALAM AND FROM 2013 HE STARTED HIS OWN PRACTICE, "ARCHITECT EMRAN & ASSOCIATES".
